Name: Republocrat
Description:
(From the back of the box) Republocrat is a game which combines a basic knowledge of American History along with luck and skill. Players travel around a circle of spaces named Democracy Boulevard to work towards their ultimate goal: Election to the Presidency.  the spaces on the board allow the players to consecutively move into 5 offices prior to reaching the final stage of the game.  The final stage of the game finds players at the National Convention and the White House.  The offices that players must pass through are: City Council, State Senate, US House of Representitives, Governor of the State and US Senate.

Players may suffer setbacks or gain sudden rewards during the game. Depending if the player answers the question correctly determines if the player moves ahead. In addition, when a player receives a "Republocrat Card", it may require the player to move ahead or go back as indicated on the card.

Republocrat not only entertains, it challenges and informs those seeking election to the presidency. The 240 United States of America questions will allow people to play the game many, many times and enjoy a new experience each time.

Name: Big Apple
Description:
In this game, players manage stores in New York City.  Stores are established in spaces on the apple-shaped board, and players manage their inventory by holding onto cards representing goods.  These cards are purchased from warehouse spaces and frequently change hands since a player is obliged to purchase a card whenever he or she lands on an opponent's store.  The maximum price which may be charged for an item depends on the number of floors in a store, so players are constantly expanding their outlets.

The game deals with more than just cash -- every player gets a balance sheet used for tracking bank loans and credit with other players.  Credit limits are determined at the start of the game and affect the length of the game -- a $300 limit is recommended for an hour-long game, while $500 can last two hours or more.  As players reach their credit limits and are unable to pay back their creditors, they go bankrupt and drop out of the game.

In addition to the normal flow of buying and selling, the game features board spaces and cards that spice up gameplay with random events.  There are also some special transportation spaces (taxis and subways) which allow players a little more control over their movement to add variety to the normal rolling and moving.

Big Apple obviously draws a lot of inspiration from Monopoly, but it's not just a retheming -- there are enough differences to make it distinct from its more famous predecessor.

Name: Gnemo
Description: Gnemo is a card game based on (and featuring) the illustration work of artist Tom Kidd.  The thematic material for the game is from the imaginary world developed in Kidd's Gnemo series of paintings.

Name: Indy's Gamble
Description:
From the designer's web site: Indy's Gamble is a brand-new card game featuring Indy and his famous movie adventures. There has not been an Indy game like this one before. The idea and design of the game was developed by me (Sascha Krasny) especially for the Indy style of adventures. The game is made for all Indy fans all over the world, especially for the readers of my page :). And now the best part: The game is completely free.

Available for download at:
http://stud4.tuwien.ac.at/~e9125985/IJC/Games/IndysGamble/

Name: Cinquo
Description: An abstract strategy game played on a 7x7 grid. The object of the game is to be the first to visit each corner and the center space, ending on the player's starting corner. However, players must play a hand of cards to determine which player gets to move. Players are dealt three cards and have to win a trick to move one of their pieces. The cards are marked like dominoes, with 1 to 6 spots, and each number comes in three different colors - red, black, and white.

Name: Economy
Description:
"By moving to the right locations you get inventions, factories and shops. With these properties you can collect points and become winner with the most points! A shop is worth 1 point, a factory 2 points and an invention 3 points (most for the invention, because  without a new invention there are no new factories and shops!) You get most if you have an invention, factory and shop of the same sector. But be careful - there is keen competition!"

Components: 8x8 game board, 36 location cards, 36 property cards, 6 pieces, die.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/economy.htm

Name: High Noon
Description:
The object of the game is to eliminate all opposing pieces.

Each player has six movement points to divide among a set of four pieces. Two pieces from each set move clockwise and the other two move counter clockwise.

Pieces landing on the same square duel. In order to win the duel, the player challenged to a duel must correctly guess whether an odd or even number of fingers will be simultaneously held up by both players.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/high.htm

Name: Checkpoints
Description: The players race across a 6x6 grid seeking to be the first to visit all four corners, with the caveat that a player's starting corner cannot be the first corner visited by the player. The spaces on the board are covered by numbered cards. Dice are rolled for movement. The player can only move onto squares showing the same number as was rolled on a die.

Name: K.O.
Description:
Each player has a set of pieces numbered 1 through 6. The object is to knock the pieces of your opponents out of the game while keeping your pieces in the game. Two standard dice are rolled for movement. The number rolled indicates both which pieces may be moved (as they are numbered one through six), and the value on the other die indicates the distance of the move. Each piece can only knock out opposing pieces bearing the same number.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/knockout.htm

Name: AlphaOmega
Description: The game is played on a 10x10 grid having letters of the alphabet marked along the row and column running through the center of the board. The players select a word at the start of the game and seek to visit all of the letters of the word in order. Landing on an opponent's piece sends it back to the start.

Name: Right-Left
Description:
An abstract strategy game played on a 7x7 grid. Four starting spaces are marked in the four player colors. The object of the game is to visit each of the four colored spaces on the board, ending with the space of your own color. Movement is controlled by a pair of dice, one dictating which direction the piece must turn during the move, and the other setting the distance of the move.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/rile.htm

Name: Witches and Wizards
Description:
Players take turns laying down cards marked with different animals, seeking to "enchant" a previously played card. The winner of each round is the player who was last able to enchant a card. There are scoring and victory conditions for party games, easy games, and "professional" games. The game consists of 32 animal cards, 2 bacillus cards, and a magic formula card.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/witch.htm accessibility

Name: State Fair: Ferris Wheel KnockOut
Description:
This game is a sort of shooting gallery for at home in a ferris wheel theme. Your target is to shoot sensors with a sort of laser-gun. When you hit the sensor with the laser a balloon pops. This game can be played alone as well as with several players (using time targets for example).

It came in a lot of different variants, all in the State Fair style (see other names). Also a lot of other target shooting games exists nothing to do with those of this brand, but they may be listed here as well.

Name: Harry Potter and The Sorcerer's Stone: Levitating Challenge Electronic Skill and Action Game
Description:
In this game you have to put a floating ball through a kind of maze, without hitting any objects, so the ball keeps floating. Time is the target of this game when you play it with more then one person.

From the box back:

"How fast can you navigate the ball through this magical maze challenge?"

"Use your powers of levitation to actually raise the ball out of the cauldron...it's amazing!  Then, skillfully navigate the ball around the maze as fast as you can in mid-air!  Listen to the wizard trainer's instructions as you go - he'll record your time and let you know if you've mastered the art of levitation."

Name: Ike-A-Doo Crazy Ikes Game
Description:
Object: To assemble, piece by piece, one of the figures on the spinner board. Each figure has twelve parts which are to be chosen by shape and not necessarily by color. First player who completes h is figure and calls, "Ike-A-Doo" is the winner.

Colorful, nostaligic game of putting together legs, heads, arms, feet and torsos into robotic-like figures called, among many others, Cap'n Ike, Ike-A-Roo, Dopey-Ike and Lazy-Ike.

Name: Kostky
Description: This is a Travel Line (pocket} edition game named Kostky published by Dino Toys in the Czech Republic. It contains six plastic dice, a dice cup, a scoring pad and a booklet of Czech and Slovak rules. Apparently it is a set of rules to play a variety of dice games.

Name: Carpet Bowls
Description: Carpet Bowls is an indoor version of Lawn Bowls.  The players take turns rolling their balls such that one of their balls is the closest to the Jack after all the balls have been rolled.    Hitting the other player's balls to move them further from the Jack is allowed, along with hitting the Jack itself.  The balls are specially weighted so that they will curve to the right or left depending on how you roll them.

Name: Puko
Description: A Polish (?) game with cards and chips a bit similar to Tripoley. This is playing without the board and with 1 deck of PUKO-cards. In the box are rules for two others cards games too.

Name: Hund und ...?
Description:
The content.
36 cards
Each card contains 3 items:
a dog and...
2 displays from the following list:
tree-car-ship-hat-moon-ball-girl-boy

The basic idea of "Hund und...?" is to develop the capability of recognizing differently displayed symbols as similar.

There are two game ideas included. The more challenging one is the second one, where the players have to notice whether any of the other items (besides the dog) appears on two cards in a row. Whoever recognizes this first, gets the cards. This variant is suitable for kids about six and up.

Name: Wimbledon
Description:
Content:
4 pawns, 4 score markers, 1 ball, 2 dice, 23 tennis cards, 1 board

Both players try to decide the mathch for themselves. The match is decided by skill, dices and tennis cards.

Name: Silber Dollar
Description:
29 cards with symbols from the wild west, dollar coins, dollar bills
2 Games:
(1) Drunter und Drueber. A Cardgame for 3 or 4 Players. It is a trick taking game. The player with the highest card (the silver dollar card) plays against all others. He decides, if the lowest (drunter) or the highest (drueber) card in the trick wins.
(2) Texas-Round-Up. For any Number of Players. The first hand plays a card and gives a limit. The sum of all other players cards should be equal. The last player takes the trick. If the sum is higher than the limit, you lose all your cards.

First edition with silver coins, second edition with yellow coins.

Name: 3x16
Description:
Summary
An abstract game in which the numbers 1-16 have to be arranged into rows, using five auxiliary columns and careful planning.

Aim of the game
Each player tries to lay three new rows, each of them starting with 1 and ending with 16, with all the numbers in between in their correct sequence. The player who first completes his/her three rows wins the game.

Game play
Each player gets 48 number tiles (three sets of numbers 1-16) and arranges them in three horizontal rows from 1 to 16. One player is selected as the caller, shuffles his/her tiles and draws them one by one from a bag. He/she calls the number drawn. Each player takes that number from one of his/her horizontal rows. If it is a 1, he/she can start one of his/her three new main rows. If it is any other number, it has to be placed in an auxiliary column first.

Each player may have up to 5 vertical auxiliary columns of any length. There must not be any gaps (i.e. tiles must be placed directly below one another), and tiles must not be rearranged later. Tiles need not be placed in sequence, but they should be placed in a way that allows for efficient removal to construct the main rows. Tiles may only be taken from the auxiliary columns starting at the bottom (not in the middle or top), and main rows can only be started when a 1 has been called.

Each of the three new rows has to be started with a 1. The tiles have to be placed in correct sequence here. A 3 can only be placed after a 2, and so on. Tiles can be taken from the auxiliary columns (without being called again) as soon as the number at the bottom directly follows one at the end of one of the player’s main rows. E.g. if there is a 3 at the end of one of the player’s main rows and a 4 at one of his/her auxiliary columns, the 4 may be taken and placed next to the 3 in the main row. Tiles can be taken from the bottom of the auxiliary columns as long as they are in matching sequence.

The player who first completes his/her three rows wins the game. If no player is able to complete all three rows by the time the caller calls the last number, the player with the fewest tiles left wins instead.
__________________

One of Ravensburger's Traveller-Series games.

Name: The Dictionary Game
Description: This has a lot of similarities to Balderdash, but has some differences as well.  First is spelling can win you points.  Second is it ships with two actual Scribner dictionaries for checking on answers.  Finally is how it constrains someone just about to win...  There is also a handicap system.  So this Canadian publisher seems to have worked out a slightly more sophisticated system to the same fun we know as Balderdash, but added enough additional stuff to make it a bit more strategic in play and more educational to boot.

Name: Tolle Tanten tanzen Tango
Description:
Content:
77 word cards, 33 picture cards

Each player gets 7 word- and picture-cards. Alternating the cards are played separately. The destination is to build a senseful sentence. Are the co-players not content with the word of my choice they had to be convinced. Mostly an incredible sentence construction with fantastic content is getting develloped. The winner is who gets played all cards and ends a sentence with that last card.

Name: Happycross
Description:
Content:
1 board,
1 Sand glass, 
1 dice cup, 
13 dice, 
1 block

The dice show the different characters of the alphabet with a point score. The rarer a character, the higher the value.
The active player throws 13 dice, and the sand glass starts to run.
Now the player has time to bring the dice into right order at the board so that they lay crossword like at the board.
The sand glass limits the time.

Now the points are counted. Not used characters bring minus points.

Name: Kerlett
Description:
Content:
1 board, 1 dice cup, 5 dice, 1 block, 36 chips

At the beginning each player gets a set of chips in one color. The dice are thrown. All players play at the same time and try to place their chips a tdifferent places of the board.
You may not place a second one in a field.
Besides real number fields which show the sum of all dice there is one field each for even and odd sums, for pairs, triplets, quadruplet, quintruplet and small and big street.
If noone wants to put down any chips, points are given for the combinations.

Name: Check-Point
Description:
Content:
1 board,
49 tiles,
72 chips

Each player has an closed deck of tile in front of him.
All players try at the same time, to place their own tiles at the right location on the board.
At the placed card a chip of the own color is put.
 As soon as a player has laid down all of his cards, the game is over. 
For each correct Karte the player gets a point. Wrong cards are good for minus points.

Name: Jagd durch Entenhausen
Description:
1 board, 6 figure cards, 60 turn cards, 6 Disney-pawns.

Mickey Mouse, Pluto, Minnie, Donald Duck, Daisy and Goofy are at the start for a funny run through Entenhausen village.
Nobody wants to be the last one. Because the last pawn loses. Therefore pay attention and exchange your pawns at the right time!

Name: Domingo
Description:
1 board, 4 sets of 7 rings in one color, 1 deck of playing cards with domino-symbols, score chart

The idea is to lay as high valued tiles as possible in the own rings.

A game from the Krone series!
Families: Series: Krone Spiele für Erwachsene (Ass / Schmidt-Spiele)

Name: 6mal6
Description:
1 board, 1 deck of cards with 72 cards of the numbers 1-9, 12 big and 90 small chips

The destination of the game is to lay higher card values onto the 6 fields of the own horizontal row than the other players  to avoid to give away own chips. The winner is the player who stll has chips at the end.
Families: Series: Krone Spiele für Erwachsene (Ass / Schmidt-Spiele)

Name: Schubs + Remmidemmi
Description:
Two games in one box. Both games were the contest winners of Ravenburgers "Spielesammlung zum Ausprobieren" (Nr. 12023, ca. 1965). Out of 7 games, they were the 2 games with the most votings to get published on their own with new designed game boards.

1. Schubs:

1 board, 5 pawns in 4 colors, 1 die

The pawns of the players have to be moved through a landscape, but each pawns needs the help of a second pawn. The cannot succeed on their own.  That forces cooperation, which noone can deny.

2. Remmidemmi

1 board (the back side of the board above), 5 pawns in 4 colors, 1 die
In this turbulent game to bring your pawns to their destination, on ways, which directions xou cannot decide allways for yourself. Own skillfulnuess ist as important as dice luck.

Name: Chess for Juniors
Description:
Real chess made easy for children.
In addition to the board and men you also get a diecut sheet showing the movement of the pieces. 
"Game I" is for beginners and the game ends when a player's king is captured, but the winner is determined by the number of points accumulated by the captured pieces.
"Game II" is a standard chess game.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Wortschatz
Description:
Content:
Board, 6 twarfs, 1 cipher die, 1 norrmal die, 15 pawns

The twarfs hear the word "treasure" and start running.

Each player takes a twarf and places it on a start field outside with a character. Let's take "B". This is also his destination around the board.
The active player throws the dice 13 times to get his characters together and marks them with pawns.All players try to put a word together out of the chosen characters.The twarf on the outside lane is set forward by the numbers of the characters. 
If two players do not find any new word the next player's turn starts and he throws the dice.
Winner is the players whose twarf is back on his startinf point.

Name: Pyramx
Description:
In former times grave robbers took rich treasures out of the pyramids. Pyramx is a tactical game.. 2 grave robber gangs try to take away captured treasures from the another gang.
The destination of the game is to conquer 3 green framed Pyramid points of the opponent and get into reach of his treasure stones.

Name: Passt!
Description: The object of the game is to complete an incomplete sentence with a word of the highest possible value

Name: 247 "two.four.seven"
Description:
Content: board with 247 fields (13 x 19), 1 stone, a team of 5 "actives" each, 1 die

247 is a die-game for 2 players.

In the game they overtake the "stone" with the help of an "active" in order to throw it tawards the opposite "out line" and finally into "out" there.
Winner is the player whose team succeeds to get the most "outs" after a certain playing time.

Name: Matchstick Game
Description:
This is a very simple game which can be played on a sheet of paper or with real matchstick. You draw (or lay) a random number of matchsticks (behind each other) on the sheet. Now one of the two players starts by taking one up to three (which can be choosen) matchsticks away. The other player does this as well and so on. The player who takes away the last matchstick loses the game.

Winning strategy: The person who starts will be able to win the game, when the amount of the beginning isn't x * 4 + 1 (where x may be every natural number). When this is the fact and the person who plays second is smart, he'll win (read what to do). But what to do when you (person who starts) can build a winning strategy?

Take away a specific amount of matchsticks (1 up to 3 of course), so the amount of matchstick still on the sheet is x * 4 + 1 (where x may be every natural number). Now make sure that in two steps (so one turn of you and one of your opponent) four matchsticks are taken away. Which means that when your opponent takes away 1, you take 3, when your opponent takes away 2 you take 2 as well and when your opponent takes away 3 you take 1. Now your opponent will always lose the game.

To try this strategy out you can play the game online: http://www.schoolbits.nl/extern-spel-13b.html

The computer starts, but doesn't directly take the winning strategy. When you make a mistake on your first turn, the computer will take the winning strategy after this turn.

Name: That's Donald Pokerface
Description:
Content:1 board, 4 Donald-pawns, 4 pawn holders, 32 playing cards with the different values

The fields on the game plan are numbered in sequenc from 1 to 71 and also show numbers on ther borders. These numbers tell the players which card they must play in order to leave each respective field.
The active player calls out a number and plays a card face down. The other players now have the task: believe that number or don't believe.Ifthactive player was right but his card was doubted, then he can move by twice that number.The doubter has to go back the same amount. The opposite way it goes when the doubter is right.
The game  is over as soon as a player reaches the finishing field.

Name: Diamantenfieber
Description: Money and diamonds - an exiting matter! Who is fit in watching the market amd buy diamonds cheaply and sell them at a high prize will soon find aut the thrill of this game around profit,

Name: El Joc del Cava
Description:
El Joc del Cava is a game that simulates the manufacture of sparkling wine in Catalonia, called cava (Protected Designation of Origin).

Components:

     Board game
     Deck of 108 cards
     24 counter
     Rules.

Name: Asalto: Jaime I conquista Mallorca
Description:
Wargame published in Spain. Edition with few means, is an incunable. It reflects the Catalan conquest from Majorca to the Muslims in 1229.
Components: book of rules, dice, map and four counter sheets.

Name: Feud
Description:
Feud is all about combat.  It is about warfare - the weaponry, the armor, the tactics, the respite, the strengths and weaknesses of participating warriors, and the suspense and mystery of an unknown outcome.  A typical game can last anywhere from ten minutes to two hours.  It is for two players, and, best of all, Feud is played with two standard decks of playing cards!  This makes Feud cheap!  And sometimes free, (the best kind of game), if you already have the cards lying around.

Feud is initially quite complex.  No one can master the concepts of Feud by playing just a few games, let alone the subtleties.  Once you have played it enough though, you will not only find it enjoyable, but rather simplistic and easy.

To ease new players into the game, a set of Basic Rules is outlined first.  Play several games of Feud with the Basic Rules.  Once you have grasped them soundly, the Advanced Rules will bring the true excitement of Feud to light.  Though we have called them "Advanced" rules, they are just an extension of the Basic Rules, and complete the game's symmetry.  If you find yourself having fun with just the Basic Rules, or Basic Feud, no worries!  Many people enjoy Basic Feud more than Advanced Feud, or True Feud.  But we urge you to try out True Feud if you have enjoyed basic Feud, especially if you like games with higher degrees of skill and lesser degrees of chance.

Name: Bienen-Stich
Description:
It is a trick-taking game with 52 honey-bee cards around two rivalling honey bee-colonies.
The player with 1000 points wins the game.

Name: Hessen Reise
Description:
The players travel through the federal state of Hesse, Germany.
They receive one town card which becomes their "home card".
They get 11 more cards which they have to organize for their travel from town to town.
The destination is the capital Wiesbaden.
The die lets the pawns move. A "free time" card is taken when a 6 is rolled. It contains events that either have to be fulfilled immediately or it can be kept to fulfill later. "Free time" cards disrupt the normal trip through Hesse.
The first player to reach Wiesbaden and get rid of all their cards, wins.

Name: Der Dieb von Maradad
Description:
4 families sell themselves mutually old treasures, antiques from their market tables for prizes, as high as possible.
The buyer is willing to pay just a little, so the haggling starts. From time to time anything will be stolen, but noone  wants to have seen it. When you have luck you can trade with a partner. You foist a pretty worthless object on the other and get an expensive antique for it. Your partner hasn't known this though.
This and much more makes "Der Dieb von Maradad" a unusually diversified game. Winner is the player who owns the most money after a certein time (=2 hours).

Name: Fighting Fantasy collectible card game
Description:
From the web site:

The Fighting Fantasy™ collectible card game (CCG) is a collectable card game based on the Fighting Fantasy™ series of interactive gamebooks published by Wizard Books. In the Fighting Fantasy™ CCG, each player assumes the role of a character card as they attempt to destroy the other player and take control of Allansia. During the course of play, this character will discover secret artifacts, learn new spells and gather monsters to their fold.

The web site was last updated in 2005: http://www.fightingfantasygamebooks.com/tradingcards.htm

Buy Microbadge

Name: Memo-Maus
Description: Mice are building themselves a racetrack with a start and a finish line. In the middle there is a "cheese-tunnel" out of swiss cheese which the ate 3 tracks inside. Through these tracks they push differently colored cheese pieces. By the pieces which come out on the other side thay know how many fields they can move forward on the racetrack.

Name: Tauchbasis X-1
Description:
Several scuba divers start from the under water platform for treasure huntingbecause the wreck of an pretty old ship is found. Unmeasurably much money was said to be there.
Each player commands three scuba divers who try to get as much money as possible from the depth.
The winner is the player with the biggest treasure at the end.

Name: Tausendsassa
Description: the group of the plyers tries to get more points than their opponent, the goblin "Tausendsassa". If thes succeed to get more points by skill and luck she has earned the title "Tausendsassa".

Name: Zwick-Zwack
Description:
In this game you don't count the fields by the die points, but instead of that the counter with the number of the thrown die is brough tonto th next vacant field.
Each player gets 6 counters of a certain color.
Each player tries to get as many counters as possible on the orange number fields.

When the three red final fields are occupied the game is over.

Name: Wortwurm
Description: A category is chosen. The clock is running. The turn player writes fitting words into the Wortwurm on the board. Who has the best ideas and writes the most words, gets the most points.

Name: Ätsch!
Description:
Where is the small plate hidden?
It has to be somewhere!

Turn by turn the players stab with a small stick into the opponent's lump of modeling clay, always on the lookout for a hidden plate.
As long as it isn't found the player on his turn throws a die and moves his pawn forward on the board. The better the plate is hidden the further a player may push his pawn.

Name: Karlchen
Description: Each player has a track for his pawn. On each field of the track there are barrier stones with the picture of Karlchen. Each player has to bring his pawn over the barrier stones as fast as possible to the finish field.

Name: Geozoo
Description:
Idea of this game is to build up a landscape on the board. For this purpose sections of landscape cuttings are placed on the board. The players get points for these placements.
Winner is the player who has the most points when the landscape is finished.

Name: Awithlaknakwe
Description:
An American Indian game attributed to the Zuni tribe of the Southwestern U.S.

A game for two or four players played on a board made up of 168 squares each intersected by diagonal lines. The board is composed of a 12x12 grid with a line of six starting/home squares parallel to and centered along each edge of the board. The players place their six pieces in these squares at the start of the game. In addition, each player has a seventh piece, which is slightly larger, known as the Priest of the Bow.

The object is to cross the board and occupy the opposing home spaces, capturing as many men as possible on the way. Moves are made one square at a time along diagonal lines, with the pieces being placed at intersecting points. The pieces may not be moved backward.

When two pieces surround an opposing piece, it is captured and removed from the board. The first captured piece is replaced by the capturing player's Priest of the Bow, which has the ability to move either on the diagonal lines as normal, or at right angles.

Name: Zum Kuckuck
Description:
The eggs lay hidden in the nests. Each player has to find out where the 3 eggs of his color are located. Whoever has collected 3 "Nest cards", is allowed to take his eggs out of the nests. But, woe, you got the egg of a cuckoo!
Each player who has collected 3 nest cards, is allowed to turn his 3 eggs over during his turn. Winner is the player with 3 found eggs.

Name: Familie Brumm
Description: Memory game.  Players move any bear around the wheel attempting to find the matching sized knife, fork or plate. If it doesn't match, you don't get it, and the next player goes. First player to 3 identical sized pieces or any six tiles wins.

Name: Igel, Frosch und Maus...
Description:
Each player tries to get as many animal cards as possible. Important is to achieves getting all four of cards of a specific animal. This gets more points and because the cards are secure when you have all 4 of them, they cannot be taken over by other players.
The winner is the player who has won more quartets of cards after a certain time.

Name: Alle meine Tiere
Description: Each player cares for eight animals of one species. On the board they lie all scattered around. The player who manages first to see all of his animals at the same time on the board has almost won. He has to answer a question and wins.

Name: Skat
Description:
Skat may be played by 2, 3 or 4 players. It is similar in mechanics to Sorry! with dice in place of cards and marbles in place of movers. The players roll a die in hopes of throwing a 1 to leave their start space in the moulded plastic game base. Traveling the track of the board, it is a race to see who can get all 4 of their marbles into their home first. When you land on a space occupied by another player you call out "skat" and send that player back to their starting spot.

In a 4 player game, you can play as teams with the goal of getting the 8 team marbles back prior to the other team. Once a player has all 4 of his in the home spaces, he can begin to move his partners marbles.

Another version of the game is Wild Skat, using an extra hole in the center of the board. This extra hole allows you the opportunity to cross the board in fewer moves, but increases your chance of being "skatted" by your opponent.

Name: Fang die Maus
Description:
Content: 90 playing cards, 9 joker, 1 big mouse

Each player tries to get rid of his own cards (=mice). All players play simultaneously and put down their cards on the 3 to 4 decks on the table. The first player who get s rid of his cards catches the mouse, and wins the game.

Name: Hüpf, mein Küken!
Description:
Kernel stones and the one stable stone are put together in a circle on the table.
The "Küken" (baby chicken) is placed on the stable stone. Each turn the player throws the die, and the Küken is moved. When it passes the stable stone, the turn player may take one kernel stone out of the circle.
The player with the first 3 colored kernel stones wins.

Name: Fischer's Fritz fischt große Fische
Description: The idea is to catch as many fish and as a big a fish as possible, but also there are many items that lie in the water, but do not belong there. The winner is the player with the highest card value at the end.

Name: Daumenlutscher
Description: Sucking thumb is a dreadful habit. Every child knows this. It is hard to get rid of this habit. This game provides 15 situations that you can come into such an embarrassing situation. Each time when your pawn puts a thumb into his mouth you are  punished by slowing down your forward progess. Who will be first to the finishing field without sucking their thumb?

Name: Die Feuerwehr ist da!
Description: Caution....it burns at several places at the same time! The players act as courageous firemen and try to put out the burning fire as fast as possible. Fast comprehension and skillful planing decide who gets the most firemen merits for successful actions.

Name: Friday Night At The ER
Description:
From the publisher's website:

The Friday Night at the ER team-learning game is a simulation tool for gaining powerful insight in an engaging group experience. It's a board game played at one or more tables of four players and led by a facilitator. The game teaches people to:
    * consider the effects of their decisions on the larger system,
    * to collaborate with an openness to redesign, and
    * to develop sound data on which to base decisions.

Who is it For?
    * Work Teams, Retreats, Classes....for Improvement Work, Restructuring, Planning, Team Building
    * Any group whose members have to work together
    * Minimum group size is 4; maximum is 200

How Does it Work?
The game simulates the challenge of managing a hospital during a typical 24-hour period. Players perform distinct functions, but they come to realize that they also depend on each other. The game play (2 hours) is followed by an interactive debriefing (1 hour or more).

What Can it Teach?
    * Systems Thinking: managing interdependence, complexity, delay
    * Collaboration: shared accountability, coordinated action across functions
    * Innovation: working with mental models, openness to redesign
    * Use of Data: system performance data, measurement
    * Structural Thinking: designing for performance

Based on The Beer Game

Name: Wahr oder gelogen?
Description:
660 incredible stories that are true or a lie.
"Elephants drink water through their trunks .. Is this true or is it a lie?" The Bremen Town Musicians have known fairy tale in the city of Bremen never reached .. etc.

Each player tries to get chips of each color. You get chips when you know after a story is read out whether it is true or false. Eight chips let you win the game.

Contents: 

     110 cards with a total of 660 true-false stories, 
     dice, 
     winning chips

Name: Hau ruck!
Description: The 24 lovely picture cards of this game are telling 8 depicted mini-stories (each within a sequence of 3 cards). You play with as many sequences as players are taking part (4-8). At the beginning of a game the redundant cards are sorted out and the rest is shuffled well. Each player gets 3 cards on hand. By shifting simultaneously one card to the left neighbor the players try to get first a complete sequence. When this happens to you, grab quickly and secretly a chip from the table. The other players immediately also catch a chip. Only the last and slowest player gets nothing, and a new game begins. After some turns (at least as many as playing members) the player with most chips wins.

Name: Siege
Description:
From publisher's press release:

Based on the classic chess, Siege is played with a standard set of chess pieces, a circular 120-space Siege board, and new objectives.

With its debut at the 2008 Canadian Toy & Hobby Fair on January 26-28 in Toronto, Siege Games is poised to unleash this innovative new game on Canadian chess players.

"If you can play chess, you can play Siege", says Frank Elstub, President of Siege Games. "Where chess represents two opposing armies facing off across a field of battle, Siege moves the conflict to the siege of a castle. The pieces move basically the same as in chess, so it's easy to get started, but there are more spaces and new perspectives, so standard chess strategies are out the window."

Name: Race for the Galaxy: The Gathering Storm
Description:
The Gathering Storm is the first expansion for Race for the Galaxy and adds new cards, an additional player, goals to compete over, as well as solitaire and drafting rules.  It also includes some blank cards for players to make their own cards.

The new cards include four start worlds, three 6-cost developments, two other new developments (and one duplicate development), five military worlds and six non-military worlds (including a replacement gambling world).  Goals consist of  ‘First Goals’, which reward the first player to achieve an objective with 3 extra VP, and ‘Most Goals’ reward the player with the most developments, military or certain types of worlds.  An extra set of player cards and VP chips allows for a 5th player, and a robot template, dice, and chits allows for a solitaire game.  Finally drafting rules provide a different way of playing the game for 2 or 3 players.

Name: Double Vision
Description: A reflector-box is put in the middle of the table. All plates are arranged in any order on the 20 spots of the board edge. The turn player pushes two of the plates in the middle of the box to see the down side. If he sees 6 symbols at the upper and the mirror side he can take this plate.

Name: Flieg zu mir
Description:
The game is a memory game for Young and Old. You will get to know many species of local birds and trees. The players let male and female birds of the same species fly in the same kind of trees.  Besides good memory, tactical skill and luck are necessary for the winner.
Each player tries to get as many bird pairs as possible .

Name: Raumschiff Galaxis
Description: Each player tries to bring 5 freight containers to the space stations with his space ship. The players block each other though, and the destination computer is playing up. Winner is the player who has delivered his freight containers and returned back to the basic field first.

Name: Fischzug
Description:
Every day courageous sailors go on a dangerous trip to the fishing areas of the world. They throw out their nets and hope of the biggest catch of their lives.
In this game the winner is the player who gets the most points out of his catch before an arranged number of fishing trips are completed.

Name: Denkste
Description: The window board is placed between the players. The turn player throws the symbol die, takes a marker and throws in into a slit with the same symbol. From now on the turn player has to memorize first how many markers are in every slit. Is his answer correct, He may throw the die once more. Is it wrong. His turn is over. The winner is the player who wins 4 rounds.

Name: Iron Road
Description:
Iron Road is the original printing of the game that would become TransAmerica.

Iron Road differs from TransAmerica in several ways though, for instance, the board is made up of squares rather than triangles, and the scoring system and game end conditions are altered as well.

Re-implemented by:

    TransAmerica

Name: Starfire: The Gorm-Khanate War
Description: Starfire, The Gorm-Khanate War was an expansion to Starfire 2nd Edition (Boxed Set). This expansion introduced new rules, and a new race and empire to the game, the Empire of Gormus. In addition, it provided a campaign based on the war between Gorm and the Khanate of Orion using the campaign expansion Starfire: New Empires for Starfire 2nd Edition.

Name: Ei der Kuckuck
Description: Each player moves the eggs of his color over the colored field of the board - towards a strange nest. Destination is to lay your own egg as a "kuckoo egg" into the nest of another player as fast as possible. Who manages this first wins the game.

Name: Lass mein Känguruh in Ruh!
Description: During the drying season all kangaroos are very thirsty. It is necessary that they reach the next water hole. The kangaroo pairs, mother and baby, must overcome the obstacles and reach the rescuing water hole. Those who reach the water first, may drink first. The player of the first kangaroo wins.

Name: Arctic
Description: Each player slips into the role of an ice bear who jumps from floe to floe. In the meantime the ice bears made a game out of it. They count the floes which they reach without falling into the water. The players take the floes which they leave and add the points of them. When no one can make any move the game is over. The player with the highest added points wins.

Name: Wichtel-Rennen
Description:
The small gnomes are smart friends. They jump from tree bloom to tree bloom, schmooze here and there and rest on a mushroom.
Each player tries to let their gnomes run through the woods so skillfully that their own forest plates are used and put on the table in a 5 x 5 pattern as maximum.  
The winner is who returns back to the gnome house first.

Name: Shopping
Description: Downwards goes the one lift, upwards the second one. In the new warehouse you can see marvelous things to buy. The skillful user of the lift will soon have full shopping bags first. The player who returns to the entrance hall with full bags first wins the game.

Name: Holiday Express
Description:
Nice to look at it....the good old steam locomotive! With much noise she moves through the landscape and brings passengers  to their vacation areas. We arrange a race and to give every player the chance to travel with the express.
Each player has 3 pawns and 3 secret tickets. The tickets show where the pawns have to travel with the Holiday Express. The winner is the player who reaches his destination with his pawn first.

Name: Obstsalat
Description:
48 cards are shuffled, and each player gets 6 cards. One card is put face-up on the table. The cards contain up to 6 different fruit. The turn player has to put down one card onto the open file. 
When the open card shows: 3 bananas, 3 strawberries and 3 pineapples, the player must have a card with at least 4 bananas or 3 strawberries or 3 pineapples.
The winner is the player who gets rid of his/her cards first.

Name: Hopsi
Description: Many rabbits hide themselves in the colorful flower meadow. Also foxes are hidden there though ... and secret subsurface ways. You must try to find the 4 rabbits of your own color and bring them home into their stable. The player who has rummaged up his 4 rabbits first wins the game.

Name: Von großen und kleinen Tieren
Description:
The animals get along well together. Sometimes they talk about who is the bigger animal. 
In this game before the turn player opens up the next card he has to foresee or to guess: "Is the next open animal bigger or smaller than the animal that is already open on the table?" For a right guess you get chips. 
The player who has filled his chip board totally wins the game.

Name: Kleine Biene flieg schnell los!
Description:
Each player tries to reach the beehive with his bee first. The honey bees fly from bloom to bloom. They may move in every direction. Does a bee meet another bee, this one must go back to the start and begin anew.
The bee which reaches the flying board of the beehive wins the game.

Name: Double
Description:
Double is a cute color domino. 
The game has 72 cards. Each card is subdivided in 3 colored sectors with a card value from 1 to 7.
The player has to get rid of his cards as fast as possible by putting them to the both ends of the open card line: yellow part aside yellow, red aside red, a.s.o.
The Player who gets rid of his cards first is the winner.

It appears that this game is very similar to, but not the same as On the Double, also by Maureen Hiron.

Name: Lord of the Things
Description:
"Amusing, easy party & family game. Collect Element stones for the Elements Fire, Water, Earth and Air. But be careful: you will find Dangers like Volcanoes, Floods, Earthquakes and Hurricanes. If you don't escape you are lost! Who will be Lord of the Things?"

Components: four game boards (earth, water, fire, air), 16 danger cards, 84 element stones (21 of each color), 4 bonus cards, and 16 player pieces (4 of each color).

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/lord.htm

Name: Network
Description:
An abstract strategy game played on a board with sixty squares bearing numbers from 1 to 6.

"A 'spacy' party & family game. Create a whole 'NETWORK' with Satellites, Net-markers, Rockets, clever actions and a little luck... You need a DIE too!"

The object of the game is to be the first player to create a 'network' by placing satellites and your net markers.

Components: gameboard, 6 satellites, 6 rockets, 24 net markers in four different colors.

http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/network.htm

Name: Feuerdrache
Description:
2 to 4 small dragons always run to a volcano in order to get fresh fire stones for their store cupboard.
On the way there are surprising trade transactions.  Which dragon has the most fire stones at the end?

Name: Blütenhupfer-Farbentupfer
Description:
Each player takes one of the meadows. Then he takes one butterfly with 2 holes in their wings. Simultaneously all players try to find a position on the board where the color which shines through the hole is the same as on the other wing side.
The player who finds it first wins, and the next round can begin.

Name: Saurus
Description: The dinos are on their way to modern times. They have to overcome obstacles along the way. Hexagonal plates are put into a cue on the table. They are the playing board. Who has struggled through all events, and has reached the modern times?

Name: Wimmelburger
Description:
Welcome to Wimmelburger -Restaurant.

Here you can make your hamburger yourself, but there are not only tasty ingredients, but also uneatable ones that can be on that burger.
Before you finish a hamburger by putting the "upper half card" on the open deck you should convince yourself that you don't have any minus cards inside. The player with the most ingredients cards wins.

Name: My Pharaoh
Description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

The players compete, as Ramses I and Ramses II, to become the most well known and pious pharaoh of the ages. Using a limited supply of "build points", the players build pyramids, obelisks, statues and temples in and around Egypt. The Ramses II player also has the opportunity to denounce or deface the monuments of his predecessor. After the players have exhausted their build points, they determine when and if each monument is discovered (by die roll for the years 1880, 1912, and 2006). Points are scored based on the piety value of the buildings and the grandeur of buildings discovered in the future, bestowing each player's pharaoh with titles ranging from "The Great" to "The Weak."

Name: Brummi
Description: People in the zoo are excited: The food for the animals ran out. All children work together to collect food in baskets and carry it to the zoo by truck (=Brummi). Whoevers basket reaches the zoo first, is the winner.

Name: Die Sonnenpyramide
Description:
In old Peru in the Inca empire King Atahualpa gave some of his people a brain teaser. Inside his palace he hid 34 animal symbols on a certain floor area.
When all symbols are solved each player counts his gold treasure.

Name: Die Dinos sind los!
Description: Each player tries to hide his dino eggs while at the same time trying to find his opponents dino eggs.  The winner is the player who best hides the most eggs.

Name: MiniT
Description:
The idea is to win a MiniT (=Mini-Tennis) Tie-Break.
The game has 56 position cards, 20 running cards, 32 forehand cards, 32 backhand cards.

The game starts with the usual serve of a normal Tie-Break.
The played cards are put down on the table so that a pattern of cards is being developed into the size of a tennis court  (8 by 5 cards). Player A starts with his serve. Then the players alternate getting 2 serves, starting with player B.
Play continues to 7 points or until a player leads by 2 points once 7 is reached.

Name: Kleine Rechenschule
Description:
4 basic arithmetic operations are exercised in this game.
Each player gets cards with a math problem. Whoever has solved all his problems first wins the game.
